news.title: Nine of the largest pharma companies ink deals with Trump to lower drug prices
news.description: President Donald Trump has pushed to lower drug prices for Americans, which are on average nearly three times higher than overseas.

news.title: Jeffrey Epstein: Dems say DOJ breaking law with plan to release files over time
news.description: President Donald Trump signed the Epstein Files Transparency Act in November.

news.title: NY Fed President Williams says some 'technical factors' distorted November's CPI reading downward
news.description: Williams said "technical factors" likely distorted November's inflation data, pushing the headline reading lower than it otherwise would have been.

news.title: Oracle stock jumps 8% as cloud provider joins investor group to run TikTok's U.S. business
news.description: The new joint venture will prevent TikTok from shutting down in the U.S. due to national security concerns.

news.title: Wall Street heads into the new week with a year-end rally in doubt
news.description: December is a seasonally strong period for stocks. But an unusually weak stretch has investors wary.

news.title: Google's boomerang year: 20% of AI software engineers hired in 2025 were ex-employees
news.description: As competition heats up for AI talent, Google turned to hiring more so-called boomerang employees in 2025.

news.title: Nasdaq rises 1% as AI trade tries to end year on high note: Live updates
news.description: The S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average both snapped their four-day losing streaks in Thursday's regular trading.

news.title: European stocks end on record high; Puma shares shed 3% after Nike earnings rattle markets
news.description: Share prices in European-listed companies moved into positive territory on Friday after a soft week.

news.title: This is how exposed European Big Pharma is to the U.S.
news.description: U.S. pricing has been the biggest issue of the year for drugmakers heavily exposed to the U.S. market.

news.title: Check out the winning hedge fund strategies of 2025
news.description: As 2025 draws to a close, hedge funds' annual performances face close scrutiny among investors.

news.title: Santa Claus rally: What is it and will it occur this year?
news.description: As the new year draws closer, eyes are turning to Wall Street to see whether it will pull off the coveted Santa Claus rally.

news.title: Trump's name added to Kennedy Center building a day after board votes to rename DC theater
news.description: President Kennedy's niece, Maria Shriver, said it is "beyond comprehension that this sitting president has sought to rename this great memorial."

news.title: November home sales struggle as supply stalls
news.description: Existing home sales edged slightly higher as prices continued to rise and supply dropped. The higher end of the market is performing better.

news.title: UnitedHealth Group commits to improvements after independent audit, patient backlash
news.description: The company said it has adopted 23 ongoing "action plans" to track and implement recommended improvements, all of which will be completed by the end of March.

news.title: Trust these numbers? Economists see a lot of flaws in delayed CPI report showing downward inflation
news.description: Thursday saw the release of a much lighter-than-expected inflation report for November, and economists are already questioning its significance.

news.title: November consumer prices rose at a 2.7% annual rate, lower than expected, delayed data shows
news.description: Economists polled by Dow Jones expected CPI to have risen 3.1% on an annualized basis.

news.title: Bank of England cuts interest rates, in welcome Christmas boost for consumers
news.description: The Bank of England voted to cut interest rates from 4% to 3.75% in its last monetary policy move of 2025.

news.title: November's inflation report is the first to be released after the shutdown. Here's what to expect
news.description: November's CPI report is expected to show the annual inflation rate at 3.1%, according to economists polled by Dow Jones.

news.title: Watch Fed Governor Christopher Waller speak on interest rates and the race to succeed Powell
news.description: Waller is one of the five finalists considered for to replace Fed Chairman Jerome Powell when his term expires in May.

news.title: Hassett says Fed independence is ‘really important’ and chair candidates shouldn’t be disqualified for being Trump’s friend
news.description: Hassett declined in a CNBC interview to directly address his own candidacy but said forging consensus is an important part of the job.

news.title: Cramer says Boeing is a buy here — plus, Wells Fargo and bank stocks keep rolling
news.description: The Investing Club holds its "Morning Meeting" every weekday at 10:20 a.m. ET.

news.title: Palo Alto Networks announces multibillion-dollar deal with Google Cloud
news.description: The agreement is an expansion of the companies' existing strategic partnership.

news.title: Inside Intel’s new Arizona fab, where the chipmaker’s fate hangs in the balance
news.description: At Intel’s new fab in Arizona, 18A is in high-volume production. With no major outside customers and a 10% government stake, is it enough to save the chipmaker?

news.title: Quad witching, Nike slides, weed rules and more in Morning Squawk
news.description: Here are five key things investors need to know to start the trading day.

news.title: European Union approves over $105 billion toward Ukraine aid package for next two years
news.description: European Union countries have agreed to allocate 90 billion euros ($105.5 billion) in aid to Ukraine for 2026 and 2027, the EU Council President said on Friday.

news.title: Brown and MIT prof shooter suspect Neves Valente is found dead, authorities say
news.description: The suspected killer, Claudio Manuel Neves Valente, 48, was a graduate students in physics at Brown University in the early 2000s.

news.title: Congressional stock trading ban bill to get a vote in new year, House Republicans say
news.description: Democrats and Republicans remain split on whether a stock trading ban should extend to President Donald Trump

news.title: House passes bill to ease permits for building out AI infrastructure
news.description: The SPEED Act now heads to the Senate, which is in the early stages of its own permitting reform talks.
